title: Multiple Problems:  Accounts, Crashes, Corrupt Pages, Etc.
content:
I do not know why I bother posting when it is easier to just uninstall all Mozilla products on any device where I might have used them reliably in the past but cannot any longer. Firefox no longer runs on my Windows 7; in fact it does not even open. That is as of your last update when the crashing began, almost two months ago though it seems longer. As for this Mac Catalina, the only system I have where I can access these pages, Firefox looks like garbage. Pages do not download entirely. Check-off boxes, click buttons and drop down menus often do not work. For all the updating on Catalina this Firefox underwent, these problems never get fixed.

I do not understand the relationship Mozilla has with SeaMonkey; but I can no longer log into my Account there on MozillaZine; and there is no alternative way to contact them. My Profile does not show when I login. It will not allow me to establish a new Account with other email addresses I use. It constantly crashes on Windows 7. The SeaMonkey browser will not open these pages on attempts to login. Since these problems with Firefox are persistent, I was going to post about them on MozillaZine, which I cannot do any longer. There is no means of reporting login problems there. Additionally, some Apple commentators on their forums believe that SeaMonkey is a storage hog. I have kept it here because it works reasonably well despite the Account problems.

SeaMonkey has the reputation of not getting rigorous support. Between that and Firefox I do not know which is worse. As I stated before in a previous thread, the check off box below does not show a check when I click on it. I hope it is clear that I am posting this through Firefox on my Mac. The Submit button is faint.
creator: tightpurchaser

title: Corrupted File Downloads Through Firefox Browser Often Occurs
content:
Hi. I've noticed that files downloaded through the Firefox browser very often come out corrupted. Just to keep in mind, I'm always on the latest version.

Nowadays, I download the same file multiple times and compare their checksums to see if any two or three are identical matches to be more certain that it turned out as it should. This is an extremely tedious and troublesome task and a waste of bandwidth and time, especially when some files like video footage shot from a high-end camera for film production can be extremely large (25-100 GB per file) and it needs to be shared and downloaded multiple times by a number of group members that are working on the film project to compare checksums to see if they match. In our case, we provide the checksums for the files before uploading to the cloud, so our members can check against it after they've downloaded the file to ensure none of frames in the footage are corrupted.

However, in most cases, the problem arises when Firefox users download something online that often doesn't have checksum they can check against. Even if they downloaded the same file two times with their checksums matching, it doesn't 100% guarantee that they aren't corrupted, since the same piece in each of the two files could be corrupted at the same spot, although very unlikely but still a possibility. Everyone in our group has very stable internet connections via ethernet cable, and not WiFi.

Could this issue be looked into to figure out what the problem is?
creator: Prezal

title: How do I restore my tabs from a previous session of Firefox?
content: Hello, a couple days ago, my PC was running a bit slower than usual and Firefox was not opening right away. I double clicked on the icon, it came up with my normal session with all my tabs, but also came up with a new session window. I stupidly/accidentally closed the session with all of my tabs. The new fresh session remained. There was no option to restore closed tabs. How do I get my old tabs back, is it possible? There were dozens of tabs that I need and can't remember them all.

title: Copying FF Profile from boot crashed HD to new HD
content: AW18 500GB mSata refused to boot. Used MiniTool Pro 12.6 to attempt recover to new Installed new mSATA, new copy of Win7Pro, no joy. Put mSata into USB enclosure, copied all 423GB to 5 TB drive, to use as source for profile. READ many versions of support pages here, copied whole "old" profile from \Roaming\profile to new drive \profiles folder. No Joy. Created NEW profile, shutdown FF, copied 'old" folder to new, restarted, no joy. Deleted NEW profile, tried copying just the logins.json, key4.db overwriting default profile files, no joy. Tried copying profile from original 500GB mSATA in case the copying to 5TB was corrupt ( used Total Commander copy with verify) I think I have tried almost all the various solutions, still no joy. Anybody have any solutions to try ( both very recent FF versions ( last two weeks) ? Thanks in advance!

title: Can not Sign in to my anti virus account.  fire fox just keeps putting sign in page back after i fill out and hit sign in
content:
I con no longer sign in to my norton 360 account with firefox browser. Just all of a sudden it just repeats the sign-in page over and over. I can not use my norton account. I type in My.norton.com and firefox will take me to the sign in web page. I click on sign-in and my saved info appears. Its the right info. But, when I click on sign-in all I get is the same sign in page. OVER AND OVER AND OVER. I have spent over 2 hours with norton support twice. They have done a great job. Tried many different things. Scanning and reinstalling and running SFC, DISM, clearing cache, changing settings and other things. So I am here asking you if know why firefox will not let me in to my norton360 account.

please help. It was working and nothing has changed so it must be something with firefox.

title: Encounterig Problem hen Trying To Restore My Profile
content:
I use Facebook for many years. Last time used it was 12 hours ago. Then, 1 hour ago, Firefox did not start, all I was able to do was to exit (option inside a small Firefox Problem Window).

I downloaded the installation files, and re-installed Firefox. It started with the two Firefox Start Pages. But I expected to see all my tabs and browsing history and plugins.

So I copied the files from my previous profile into the folder of the newly created profile after I deleted the new profile files. But now, when starting Firefox, I get again a small window with the option to create again a new empty profile or just to exit. It says I would use an "older" version of Firefox and this could destroy my profile.

What must I do to get back all my tabs and plugins and all that?
creator: SvenLittkowski
